articles.title: EYE ON TECH: TECH REGULATIONS
articles.description: Tim Cook says that tech regulations are coming, and he's very likely correct. CBS News Technology Consultant Larry Magid has today's "Eye on Tech."

articles.title: Naloxone: The life-saving drug more Americans need
articles.description: With over 115 Americans dying a day in the opioid epidemic, naloxone has become a necessity for first responders, doctors and everyday people. Lesley Stahl reports

articles.title: Tim Green: Coping with the ALS he thinks was caused by the game he loves
articles.description: The former Syracuse standout and Atlanta Falcon never shied away from acknowledging the dangers of football. Now, 22 years after "60 Minutes" first met him, Green is suffering from a fatal ailment he may have seen coming. Steve Kroft reports.

articles.title: Evzio: The overdose-reversal drug with a $4000+ price tag
articles.description: Naloxone can save the life of someone experiencing an opioid overdose, but is it accessible? The price for an injector of the drug has skyrocketed. Lesley Stahl reports

articles.title: Food, home, naloxone: One family's struggle
articles.description: A Utah grandmother recalls bringing food to her homeless, drug-addicted granddaughter. "She was skin and bones; she told me how hard it was to be on heroin."

articles.title: Trump to be briefed by CIA on Khashoggi killing, weighs next steps with Saudi Arabia
articles.description: A U.S. official tells CBS News the CIA believes Saudi Crown Prince Mohammad Bin Salman ordered the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi. William Inboden, executive director at Clements Center for National Security, joins CBSN to discuss the latest about the …

articles.title: First responders in Paradise, California, help fellow residents
articles.description: Residents of Paradise, California, come together after enduring unimaginable heartache. Many first responders who were victims themselves went right back to work helping others. Miraya Villareal reports.

articles.title: Missing submarine with 44 aboard found deep in Atlantic
articles.description: A submarine that disappeared a year ago off Argentina has been found. An underwater drone made the discovery nearly 3,000 feet down in the Atlantic. All 44 crewmembers died.

articles.title: Prime Minister Theresa May says change in leadership will not affect Brexit
articles.description: British Prime Minister Theresa May warned Sunday a change in leadership would not make Brexit any easier. During a tense five-hour meeting of the Cabinet on Wednesday, ministers reluctantly agreed to sign off on the draft, which critics say keeps the U.K. fin…

articles.title: Tim Green on his emotional 60 Minutes interview
articles.description: After a devastating ALS diagnosis, former NFL player Tim Green cries "tears of joy" and calls himself "fortunate," echoing Lou Gehrig's farewell speech

articles.title: Death toll rises in wildfire that swept Paradise, California
articles.description: More than 1,200 people are still unaccounted for in the Camp Fire, which has burned over 149,000 acres in Northern California. At least 76 people have been killed. Meg Oliver reports.

articles.title: Saving your child from an opioid overdose
articles.description: Theo Haskins describes saving her son, Mitch Blain, from an opioid overdose with the powerful drug, naloxone

articles.title: Food, home, naloxone: Saving an addicted daughter's life
articles.description: A Utah grandmother recalls bringing food to her homeless, drug-addicted granddaughter. "She was skin and bones; she told me how hard it was to be on heroin."

articles.title: Trump refuses to listen to audio of slain journalist's final moments
articles.description: President Trump said he doesn't want to listen to a recording of Jamal Khashoggi's final moments. The CIA has intelligence indicating Saudi Crown Prince Mohammad Bin Salman ordering the hit against the journalist, but no government agency has issued a definit…

articles.title: Democrat Bill Nelson concedes Florida Senate race to republican Rick Scott
articles.description: Democrat Sen. Bill Nelson conceded defeat to Republican Gov. Rick Scott in Florida. Scott thanked his opponent for his years in public service. In the gubernatorial race, Democratic candidate Andrew Gillum conceded to Republican Ron DeSantis, two days after a…

articles.title: "CBS Weekend News" headlines for Sunday, November 18, 2018

articles.title: Trump tours wildfire devastation, stands firm on climate change stance
articles.description: President Trump was in California this weekend touring the devastation from the state's deadliest wildfires in history. Zeke Miller, White House reporter for The Associated Press and CBSN political contributor, joins CBSN to analyze this week's political news.

articles.title: Does washing raw chicken make it safer to eat?
articles.description: The practice is very common, but researchers say people have it all wrong

articles.description: Naloxone can save the life of someone experiencing an opioid overdose, but is it accessible? The price for an injector of the drug has skyrocketed
articles.content: Drug companies jacking up the price of life-saving medications can seem arbitrary, cruel, and even scandalous. The infamous CEO Martin Shkreli hiked the price of Daraprim, a drug used by AIDS patients to fend off infections, from $13.50 To $750 for one pill. … [+13625 chars]

articles.title: One of the first Native American women elected to Congress heads to Washington
articles.description: Democrat Deb Haaland of New Mexico is one of the first Native American women elected to Congress. She joined CBSN to discuss why she ran, what she hopes to accomplish and why she thinks Nancy Pelosi is the best person to be the speaker of the House.

articles.title: Democrat Andrew Gillum concedes to Republican Ron DeSantis in Florida's gubernatorial race
articles.description: Democrat Andrew Gillum on Saturday ended his bid to become Florida's first African American governor. In a Facebook video with his wife by his side, Gillum congratulated Republican Ron DeSantis on being the next governor of Florida.

articles.title: Operation Murder
articles.description: Two doctors who hired a hit man to kill find out he wasn’t a killer at all.  "48 Hours" correspondent Peter Van Sant has the latest chapter in the twisted tale.

articles.title: Hit man or hero?
articles.description: In an exclusive interview with "48 Hours," Moataz Azzeh, who posed as a hit man, describes how he lied to Leon Jacob after being hired to kidnap Jacob's ex-girlfriend. Azzeh claims he was trying to save her life.

articles.title: 11/17: CBS Evening News
articles.description: Trump meets California officials as wildfire death toll rises; Neighbor stays behind to save homes from wildfires.

articles.author: Caroline Linton
articles.title: Portland police report weapons at demonstrations
articles.description: A small protest called #HimToo organized by the far-right group Patriot Prayer was met by hundreds of counter-protesters
articles.content: A small protest called #HimToo organized by the far-right group Patriot Prayer was met by hundreds of counter-protesters in Portland on Saturday, CBS Portland affiliate KOIN reports. The protests were meant to be peaceful, but clashes began as the groups star… [+2537 chars]

articles.title: Counter-protesters, protesters spar at conservative rally in Philadelphia
articles.description: A conservative rally that drew in far-right groups such as the Proud Boys was met with hundreds of counter-protesters in downtown Philadelphia. CBS Philadelphia's Alicia Nieves reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: The craving for hot sauces is heating up
articles.description: The popular web series "Hot Ones," in which celebrities are interviewed while eating violently-hot chicken wings, speaks to the public's increased taste for ever-hotter condiments
articles.content: Celebrities like Natalie Portman, Tyra Banks and Jeff Goldblum have tried to beat the heat on the hugely popular weekly web series, "Hot Ones," on which celebrities are interviewed while eating violently-hot chicken wings. And at about 3 million views per epi… [+2429 chars]

articles.title: Neighbor stays behind to save homes from wildfires
articles.description: As a firestorm raged into a Southern California neighborhood, one resident stayed behind in an effort to save homes. Carter Evans reports.

articles.title: Cleanup still underway in Florida, five weeks after Hurricane Michael
articles.description: More than five weeks after Hurricane Michael slammed the Florida Panhandle, residents are still picking up the pieces. Omar Villafranca reports.

articles.title: FBI investigating death of American woman on cruise ship
articles.description: The FBI is investigating the death of 52-year-old woman who was a passenger on a cruise ship heading from Florida to Aruba. Kenneth Craig reports.

articles.author: CBS/AP
articles.title: Cyclone Gaja kills 33 in India with thousands in relief camps
articles.description: State authorities on Saturday rushed drinking water, food and paramedics to nearly 82,000 people who took shelter
articles.content: NEW DELHI — The death toll from a cyclone that hit the coast of southern India has risen to 33. India's navy has assigned two ships and a helicopter for relief work. State authorities on Saturday rushed drinking water, food and paramedics to nearly 82,000 peo… [+781 chars]

articles.title: Trump says answers will go to Mueller team next week
articles.description: President Trump said he "very easily" answered written questions from special counsel Robert Mueller, though he speculated that the questions were written to catch him in a lie. Errol Barnett reports.

articles.title: Migrant caravan reaches southern U.S. border
articles.description: About 3,000 migrants from a Central American caravan have reached Mexico's border with Southern California. Thousands more are headed their way. John Blackstone reports.
